title: When one (1) Spouse is filing in California, do you use 2 for the number in your household for the median family income
question: RE: Part 2 Chapter 7 Statement Of Your Current Monthly Income
answers: My colleagues have provided you with good answers. I would just add that bankruptcy is a complicated legal process and the accurate preparation of the bankruptcy paperwork is very important. You want to go into your bankruptcy case with thorough and accurate information so your case goes smoothly. I suggest you consult with an experienced bankruptcy attorney.

Bankruptcy law is the same throughout the US. You indicate the number of people living in your household. In some communities, a household is "heads on beds" while elsewhere it is measured by providing support to a group. Hope this perspective helps!
Yes, you include your spouse and their income and if any other dependents live in your household, include them too.

Yes - you would include your spouse in the household size whether (s)he is filing jointly or not.
Don't forget to include their income as well.
